description: Egyptian fractions: number of solutions to 1 = 1/x_1 + ... + 1/x_n in positive integers x_1 < ... < x_n.
comments: All denominators in the expansion 1 = 1/x_1 + ... + 1/x_n are bounded by A000058(n-1), i.e., 0 < x_1 < ... < x_n < A000058(n-1). Furthermore, for a fixed n, x_i <= (n+1-i)*(A000058(i-1)-1). [_Max Alekseyev_, Oct 11 2012]If on the other hand, x_k need not be unique, see A002966. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 17 2013
references: Mohammad K. Azarian, Diophantine Pair, Problem B-881, Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 37, No. 3, August 1999, pp. 277-278.  Solution published in Vol. 38, No. 2, May 2000, pp. 183-184.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
